training.name: Level 2 - Independent accountant
training.description:
"1. Module I Financial accounting and professional ethics 
2. Module II Tax law
3. Module III. Selected problems of labor law, social security and economic law"

training.name: RULES OF ACCOUNTING AND SPENDING TRADE UNIONS' FINANCIAL FUNDS
training.description:
"1. The statute of the trade union organization as the basis for accounting.
2. Accounting documents.
3. Cash register in a trade union organization.
4. Books and records.
5. Balance sheet and reporting.
6. CIT and PIT 8C - the problem of submitting a document and statutory benefits.
7. Responsibility of the management board of the union for keeping the accounts, the role of the treasurer.
8. The role of the audit committee.
9. Deregistering the organization from the Tax Office and liquidation proceedings."

training.name: Accounting - from basics to an independent accountant - Level 1 and 2
PROJECT BUDGETING - CREATION TOOLS
training.description:
"1. Session 1 Project schedule and cost estimate:
2. Project planning process:
3. Project goals,
4. Submitting and approving projects,
5. Project implementation procedure,
6. Settlement of projects, etc.
7. Session 2 Project budget:
8. Relationship between cost estimate and project budget,
9. Material and financial project budget,
10. Accrual and cash method in the project budget,
11. Cash flow budget according to maturity;"

training.name: CERTIFIED CONTROLLING SPECIALIST
Budget accounting course
Changes in VAT from 2021
training.description:
"SLIM VAT - CHANGES PLANNED FOR 2021:
1. A package of provisions clarifying and supplementing VAT:
2. changes regarding the split payment mechanism and the VAT account,
3. changes to the White List of Taxpayers,
4. changes in the matrix of VAT rates and Binding Rate Information,
5. clarifying changes in the scope of the new SAF-T VAT,
6. introducing the possibility of applying, for the purposes of VAT, the rate of currency conversion on the basis of income tax."

training.name: Independent accountant - balance sheet (Rewizor and Symfonia - finance and accounting)
BALANCE SHEET 2020 - CLOSING OF THE YEAR 2020 - VAT
training.description:
"1. New rules for issuing invoices to fiscal receipts from January 1, 2020.
2. New matrix of VAT rates and Binding Rate Information from July 1, 2020. Cash registers in 2020: obligation to use on-line cash registers, use of existing cash registers, electronic receipts, cash registers in the form of software.
3. New JPK_VDEK from October 1, 2020 and the rules for keeping records for VAT purposes.
4. Amendments to VAT taxation rules for intra-Community transactions - adaptation of the act to changes in the Directive from July 1, 2020.
5. Changes in VAT from 2021 - the so-called ""slim VAT"" package."

training.name: BUDGET ACCOUNTING IN A NUTSHELL - SPECIAL RULES FOR BUDGET ACCOUNTING
OBLIGATIONS OF ACCOUNTING OFFICES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT
training.description:
"1. Scope of the act on counteracting money laundering and terrorist financing.
2. Obligation to register ""above-threshold"" transactions and suspicious transactions.
3. Obligation to register suspicious transactions about which the accounting office obtained information.
4. Reporting obligation.
5. Obligation of ongoing analysis of transactions.
6. Use of publicly available documents or information.
7. Obligation to act with due diligence to identify the beneficial owner and verify his identity.
8. Obligation of ongoing monitoring.
9. Risk based approach, risk assessment and risk areas.
10. Risk assessment analysis.
11. Criminal liability."

training.name: BALANCE SHEET 2020
training.description:
"1. Closing the books of accounts and preparing separate financial statements.
2. Corporate income tax.
3. Personal income tax.
4. Tax on goods and services."

training.name: Level 1 - Accounting basics course - for future accountants
training.description:
"1. Module I Financial accounting basics and elements of professional ethics
2. Module II Selected public law issues"

training.name: ACTION BALANCE SHEET 2020 - ACCOUNTING
BALANCE SHEET 2020
training.description:
"1. Session I: Accounting
2. Session II: Taxes"

training.name: Level 1 - accounting basics course
training.description:
"1. Module I Financial accounting basics and elements of professional ethics
2. Module II Selected public law issues"

training.name: CHIEF ACCOUNTANT
ACCOUNTING ASSISSTANT

Financial Director / Chief Accountant. Legal and financial, disciplinary, misdemeanor, criminal and civil liability for significant mistakes in management accounting - machines, technological lines - in the eye of an expert witness. Rigorous requirements in 2020.
training.description:
"1. the latest information in the field of protection of both personal (criminal, fiscal, civil) and financial (compensation) interests of members of the company's management board, 
2. including in particular the financial director / chief accountant in the context of putting into operation machines, technological lines financed with own resources, loans, grants from the European Union"

training.name: VAT invoice 2021 (changes in correcting invoices, NIP receipts, invoice in the new JPK)
Level 1 - accounting basics course for future accountants
training.description:
"1. Module I Financial accounting basics and elements of professional ethics 
2. Module II Selected public law issues"

training.name: Level 3 - course for future chief accountants
Practical application of MS Excel in the audit of financial statements
training.description:
"1. Presenting and practicing MS Excel spreadsheet functions that may be useful in conducting an audit of financial statements.
2. Identification of audit procedures where a spreadsheet can be used to facilitate work.
3. Expanding and systematizing knowledge in the field of using the MS Excel spreadsheet."

training.name: Revenue from sales - determination, recognition and presentation in the light of the Accounting Act
training.description:
"1. Consolidation of knowledge in the field of determining, recognizing and presenting revenues in accordance with the Accounting Act.
2. Discussion of issues related to the determination, recognition and presentation of revenues in accordance with national accounting standards.
3. Discussion of the rules of conduct in the absence of regulations regarding the recognition of revenues in the Accounting Act and national accounting standards.
4. Extending the knowledge of recognizing revenues from specific types of transactions.
5. Detailed knowledge on the presentation and disclosure of information in financial statements."

training.name: Chief Accountant Course
Accounting basics course
training.description:
"1. independent bookkeeping and determining the financial result; 
2. learning such concepts as: fixed assets, short-term investments, settlements, costs and capitals, funds and reserves; working with various types of accounting reports;"

training.name: Independent Accountant I
training.description: basic, fixed rules for the functioning of the accounting system and the related conceptual and terminological apparatus

training.name: Independent Accountant in Commercial Books, 1st and 2nd degree accounting course
Public finance, accounting
Level 1 - Accounting basics course - for future accountants
training.description:
"1. Financial accounting basics and professional ethics;
2. Selected public law issues;"

training.name: Computer accounting (InsERT Rewizor GT program)
training.description: Computer accounting (InsERT Rewizor GT programme)

training.name: SUBIEKT FAKTURANT programme
training.description:
"1. starting the Subiekt program correctly,
2. operating the Fakturant program correctly,
3. entering company data into the appropriate program,
4. entering the goods into the warehouse,
5. selling a specific product correctly,
6. issuing the relevant documents: invoices, bills, receipts, transfers, KP, BP, KW, BW, PZ, WZ,
7. printing out documents: invoices, bills, receipts, transfers, KP, BP, KW, BW, PZ, WZ, price lists,
8. conducting an inventory of the warehouse,
9. creating appropriate reports on: goods, services, companies and documents,
10. archiving data;"

training.name: Accountant
Accounting technician
training.description:
"1. EKA.05. Handling HR and payroll issues as well as financial management of organizational units
2. EKA.07. Accounting"

training.name: Accounting assisstant
COMPUTER ACCOUNTING INCLUDING NEW SOLUTIONS IN THE AREA OF SETTLEMENTS WITH ZUS AND US
training.description:
"1. basic computer skills (Word, Excel),
2. income tax, VAT tax,
3. operation of the computer financial and accounting SYMFONIA and PAYER programme,
4. changes and new settlements in the area of settlements with ZUS and US;"

training.name: KEEPING A COMPUTER BOOK OF REVENUE AND EXPENDITURE WITHTHE SYMPHONY AND PAYER PROGRAM
HR and payroll course
Computer accounting course
training.description:
"1. Accounting basics
2. Labor law
3. Settlements with ZUS
4. Book of revenues and expenses
5. SYMPHONY - Small Accounting
6. SYMPHONY - Finance - Accounting
7. Tax Ordinance
8. Settlements with the Tax Office
9. PŁATNIK programme"

training.name: COURSE: COMPUTER ACCOUNTING (PKPIR) WITH SETTLEMENTS WITH ZUS
COURSE: SMALL BUSINESS ACCOUNTING WITH ZUS settlements
Computer accounting course
training.description:
"1. Book of revenues and expenses 
2. Simplified forms of small business' tax records 
3. Principles of accounting records in the form of a book of revenues and expenses
4. The use of computer programs to keep a book of revenues and expenses: Optima and Symfonia
5. Classification and characteristics of assets and their financing sources 
6. Balance sheet 
7. Economic operations 
8. Bookkeping account 
9. Turnover and balances statement as a tool for checking the correctness of postings (operation and preparation rules) 
10. VAT tax
11. Nominal accounts 
12. Categories of revenues and costs 
13. Costs by team 4"

training.name: Computer accounting with elements of human resources and payroll
Independent accountant - tax specialist with the Optima program
Closing the books of accounts and drawing up separate financial statements - BALANCE SHEET ACTION 2020
Selected issues in accounting and financial reporting - BALANCE SHEET ACTION 2020
Employee Capital Plans in the public sector
training.description:
"1. Employer and PPK (Employee Capital Plans)
2. Employee and PPK
3. PPK funds
4. PPK - general remarks"

training.name: Inventory - as the basic action in closing the financial year
training.description:
"1. Legal bases. The essence, purpose and scope of the inventory, including the discussion of problem situations in the face of the coronavirus pandemic.
2. Time limits and frequency of inventories.
3. Organization of the inventory - obligatory activities that should be performed before, during and after the inventory.
4. Inventory of intangible assets.
5. Inventory of library collections.
6. Recognition of inventory differences in the books of accounts and the rules of making compensations.
7. The most common mistakes made when taking inventory."

training.name: INVOICES 2020/2021 - invoices in the context of the new JPK and the matrix of VAT rates, invoices issued to the receipt, advance and corrective invoices and other significant changes
training.description:
"1. The definition of an invoice
2. Types of invoices and their content - what do I have to and what can I include in an invoice?
3. VAT invoice, the new JPK and the matrix of VAT rates
4. Invoices issued for the receipt
5. Advance invoices
6. Correction invoices
7. Re-invoicing services
8. Rules for storing invoices
9. Documenting intra-community transactions and exports"

training.name: CASH REGISTERS IN THE COMPANY 2020/2021 - online, virtual and old-style cash registers - advantages and disadvantages, e-receipt, invoice for the receipt, fiscal receipts in JPK, problems and practical solutions
training.description:
"1. Regulations concerning issues related to cash registers
2. Exemptions from the obligation to use a cash register
3. Cash register in the company
4. Cash registers with electronic data recording, on-line cash registers, virtual cash registers
5. Documenting sales, issuing receipts with NIP (tax identification number)
6. Names of goods or services and VAT rates in a cash register
7. Advances and corrections at the cash register
8. Practical problems related to the use of cash registers
9. Presentation of fiscal receipts in JPK"

training.name: Tax end of the year 2020
Financial risk management in an enterprise
Closing of budget accounting books and organizational units for 2020
Personal income tax for 2020 - new forms of submitting templates - changes in PIT from 2021
VAT tax in the budgets of communes
Violation of public finance discipline
Changes in VAT
Tax book of revenues and expenses

training.description: accounting, bookkeeping, banking, insurance

training.name: finance, accounting, taxes
